{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3297074,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T16:18:12.043Z","cooked":"

hi everybody,

i thought some folks might be interested in our latest experiences with the NavX Micro using I2C through the MXP port. This combination has worked in the past, but lately we noticed the RoboRIO would stop responding to outside stimuli: you could ping it, but you couldn’t SSH to it, and the driver station also wouldn’t be able to talk to it, though the “COMM” light would remain lit, and the Ethernet port lights would keep blinking… Removing the usage of I2C made the problem disappear.

Maybe the 2024 image handles I2C on MXP differently than previous versions?

(we use this combination because some of our NavX Micros are missing their USB connectors.)

Anyway, FYI.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T16:18:12.043Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":44,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":247.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3297080,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T16:27:19.369Z","cooked":"

I2C on the RoboRIO has been known to cause hangs, including the MXP I2C bus. Apparently hangs when using MXP are less common, but I’ve seen it reported many times before on CD, so it’s not just a problem this year.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T16:27:19.369Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":45.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/2","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297086,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T16:31:51.841Z","cooked":"
FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Known Issues

This article details known issues (and workarounds) for FRC ® Control System Software. Open Issues: AdvantageScope isn’t updated by WPILib Installer on macOS: Issue: When running the WPILib Install...

The issue is not officially identified as affecting the MXP port, but I’ve personally seen it (or something exceptionally similar), so it can happen.

Best option is to just treat i2c on the rio as completely broken and find alternate options.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T16:31:51.841Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/yearly-overview/known-issues.html#onboard-i2c-causing-system-lockups","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/3","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297109,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T16:52:20.774Z","cooked":"

Just adding another data point that I’ve seen exactly what you’re describing in prior years.

oh, with the NavX? that’s good to know.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T17:30:25.648Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297178,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T18:23:44.374Z","cooked":"

Yes, it was a NavX MXP. In that team’s case the fix was just going over SPI, they weren’t intentionally using I2C in the first place.

Other teams have used the MXP I2C bus successfully, as you’ve mentioned you have, which is why some are under the impression the port works fine. I don’t know what the root cause is, nor do I know why sometimes it’s a problem and other times it’s not. Maybe some RIOs are more prone than others, maybe it’s a factor of wiring. Either way, I wouldn’t trust it in a match.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T18:24:11.376Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"Joshua J","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53190,"username":"truher","name":"joel truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19116,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)"},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/6","custom_user_title":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297213,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T18:40:05.553Z","cooked":"

I have had this argument with many teams before who said “it worked just fine on our other robot” and have given up and given the argument to the lead CSA at worlds before. Sometimes it’s pointless to argue with that.

The gist of it is, there is a lockup caused by I2C on the roboRIO which NI has investigated for months before and couldn’t find the root cause. No one knows why it happens we just know that it does.

Yikes, we had trouble in 2020 with the I2C ports, and then they announced the “known issue” with a workaround to use the MXP I2C port. We did successfully use the MXP I2C port on our 2022 robot, so I thought this was a solid workaround. Now you all have me questioning our plan to use the REV color sensor this season!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-30T04:25:31.775Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/8","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297643,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-30T04:43:12.914Z","cooked":"

Someone on the WPILib team (I believe @Peter_Johnson?) has posted before about the issue. I don’t remember all the details, but I believe it was something to do with a 3rd-party low-level driver, so both out of our control and unlikely to get fixed.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-30T04:46:21.016Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9105,"username":"Fletch1373","name":"Fletch","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/10","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297648,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-30T04:53:35.035Z","cooked":"

Usually when I hear about problems with the mxp I2C port it’s with very long signal lines or MXP muxes and related to very long read times, rather then complete lockup like was reported here.

Reliability of Onboard I2C port for 2022 Technical
The MXP one had a lot less reports, and my theory is that its actually a clock stretching failure. The report wasn’t a kernel hang, but was just that the i2c read calls could take 1 second to complete. Which is exactly what i2c clock stretching would do, and is a part of the i2c spec.

Nevermind, I do see you say you’ve seen a kernel lockup before on MXP I2C.

nstrike:

would love to read it though!

Reliability of Onboard I2C port for 2022 Technical
The investigations so far into the onboard I2C problem indicate it is likely an unconstrained timing issue in the I2C core used to implement the interface in the Rio’s FPGA. This means the probability of occurrence of the failure will vary from Rio to Rio, potentially from image to image, and even due to temperature. A single data point of testing can be misleading, which is why there is the blanket recommendation to not use the onboard I2C port. The symptom of this failure is a kernel locku…
","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-30T04:57:30.736Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":452516,"topic_slug":"navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/reliability-of-onboard-i2c-port-for-2022/399394/102","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Reliability of Onboard I2C port for 2022","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/reliability-of-onboard-i2c-port-for-2022/399394/152","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Reliability of Onboard I2C port for 2022","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19116,"username":"thatnameistaken","name":"Joshua J","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/navx-micro-2c-mxp-roborio-hangs/452516/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297900,"name":"mandrews281","username":"mandrews281","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-30T16:19:01.198Z","cooked":"

Having just “solved” our issue I can confirm the I2C port on the MXP with the NavX has issues. Our code had included the I2C.Port definition rather than the SPI.Port for the navx constuctor; and we saw all the symptoms described here (dropped ssh, no DS interactions, repower required, …).

If anyone is interested, I have dmsg output when the crash happens here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gWnW4voYZPowmk67eWRJpniriuAy_ffE/view?usp=sharing . But looks like the NavXIOThread is triggering (or at least involved in) some kernel memory errors. The dmesg output includes i2c timeout errors, and the stack trace includes routines like i2cdev_ioctl.

My recommendation is to avoid I2C on the rio.
